summary: This is a letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office to Judge Kenneth M. Karas, providing an update on the defense's request for video footage from outside Nicholas Tartaglione's cell at the MCC on July 22-23, 2019. The letter explains that the MCC inadvertently preserved video from the wrong cell tier, and the requested footage from outside the cell Tartaglione shared with Jeffrey Epstein no longer exists due to technical errors.

persons.name: Kenneth M. Karas
persons.context: The judge presiding over the case United States v. Nicholas Tartaglione, to whom this update letter is addressed.

persons.name: Nicholas Tartaglione
persons.context: The defendant in the criminal case (S4 16 Cr. 832 (KMK)). He was sharing a cell with Jeffrey Epstein at the MCC on July 22-23, 2019.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: He was the cellmate of defendant Nicholas Tartaglione in Cell-1 at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) on July 22-23, 2019.

persons.name: Geoffrey S. Berman
persons.context: The United States Attorney for the Southern District of New York who respectfully submitted this letter to the court.

connections.description: They shared a cell (Cell-1) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) on July 22-23, 2019.

events.title: MCC Response to Tartaglione/Epstein Cell
events.description: At approximately 1:27 a.m., MCC corrections officers responded to Cell-1, which was shared by defendant Nicholas Tartaglione and Jeffrey Epstein.

events.title: Defense Request for Video Preservation
events.description: Defense counsel requested that MCC preserve video footage from outside the defendant's cell from July 22, 2019 at 11:00 p.m. through July 23, 2019 at 4:00 a.m.

events.title: Government Receives Incorrect Video
events.description: The MCC provided the Government with a copy of the video it had preserved, which was later determined to be from the wrong cell tier (Cell-2 instead of Cell-1).

locations: United States Courthouse, White Plains, New York 10601
keyFacts: The MCC inadvertently preserved video from the wrong cell tier (Cell-2) instead of the cell (Cell-1) shared by Nicholas Tartaglione and Jeffrey Epstein on July 22-23, 2019.
The requested video footage from outside Cell-1 for the critical time period (July 22, 11:00 p.m. to July 23, 4:00 a.m.) no longer exists due to technical errors on a backup system.
The FBI reviewed the backup system for an unrelated investigation and determined the requested video had not existed since at least August 2019.
The incident prompting the video request occurred on July 23, 2019, at approximately 1:27 a.m., when MCC corrections officers responded to the cell shared by Tartaglione and Epstein.
